title: EBay stock drops after CEO Devin Wenig steps down
text: Shares of eBay Inc. EBAY, -0.29% fell 2.5% in premarket trading Wednesday, after the e-commerce company said Chief Executive Devin Wenig has stepped down, after about four years in the role and 12 years with the company. The company said it appointed Chief Financial Officer Scott Schenkel as interim-CEO. EBay said it will begin searching for a permanent CEO, and will consider both internal and external candidates. The company said Andy Cring, vice president of global financial planning and analysis, has been appointed interim-CFO. Separately, the company affirmed its 2019 net earnings-per-share guidance range of $1.97 to $2.07 and its adjusted EPS outlook of $2.70 to $2.75, which compares with the FactSet consensus of $2.75. EBay's stock has rallied 40.9% year to date through Tuesday, while the SPDR Consumer Discretionary Select Sector ETF XLY, -0.46% has gained 20.7% and the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.35% has advanced 14.9%.
